subject: Self Care
title: Self-Compassion and Motivation
description: A 60-second lesson on Self-Compassion and Motivation.

hook.text: If I stop being hard on myself, won't I become lazy? That's the biggest myth about self-compassion.

buildup.text: Research shows self-compassionate people are more motivated, not less. They try again faster after failure.

discovery.text: Self-criticism creates fear of failure. Self-compassion creates safety to fail. Safe people take more risks.

twist.text: The inner critic doesn't motivate â€” it paralyzes. People avoid challenges to avoid the punishment of self-attack.

climax.text: Motivate yourself like a good coach: honest about mistakes, encouraging about next steps, never cruel about the person.

punchline.text: Compassion fuels motivation. Criticism fuels avoidance.

quiz.question: How does self-compassion affect motivation according to research?
options: Self-compassionate people are more motivated and resilient after failure
It has no effect on motivation
